alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 11 at 9:59PM EST until March 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Missouri... Mississippi River at New Madrid. .Due to high water levels from the Ohio River Basin, the Mississippi River is in minor flood at New Madrid. It is forecast to drop below flood stage Saturday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Madrid. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 34.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Friday was 34.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 28.1 feet Monday, March 21. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
